column1: he transcript provides an update on the financial performance of Fidelity National Information Services (FNIS) for the third quarter of 2020. The company's Title segment generated a record adjusted pre-tax title earnings of $528 million, a 21.2% adjusted pre-tax title margin, and $2.5 billion in total revenue. The F&G segment produced $442 million in revenue and had a 40% increase in direct orders closed, driven by an 87% increase in daily refinance orders closed and 8% increase in daily purchase orders closed. The Corporate segment generated $50 million in revenue. The company's acquisition of FGL Holdings has been successful, with F&G's recent entrance into the bank and broker-dealer channel surpassing expectations. The sale of F&G Reinsurance to Aspida Holdings has resulted in a terrific outcome for F&G, its clients, employees, and shareholders. The company has also announced a quarterly cash dividend of $0.36 per share and plans to target $500 million in share repurchases over
